alert.note: Alert for Eastern Grant; Eastern Mineral; Hampshire; Hardy (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 15 at 4:22AM EST until November 16 at 12:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO MIDNIGHT EST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Wintry mix expected for elevations above 1,000 feet. Total snow and sleet accumulations around a coating to two inches and total ice accumulations around a trace up to a tenth of an inch. * WHERE...Portions of western Maryland, northwest Virginia and eastern West Virginia. * WHEN...From 10 AM this morning to midnight tonight. For elevations above 1,000 feet. A wintry mix will overspread the area between 10 AM and 1 PM late this morning into early afternoon. Precipitation will change to rain for most areas, but rain will freeze on elevated surfaces above 1,000 feet before ending tonight. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Visibility will be reduced to under 1 mile at times in a wintry mix as well as fog for the ridges above 2000 feet.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Grant; Eastern Mineral; Hampshire; Hardy
